name: Robert Petty
text: They are a detox clinic and have been helping struggling addiction problems for over 25 years. They have a wonder,helpful and polite staff to help the recovering addicts adjust to a life without substance abuse. You will need to call ahead and talk with one of the friendly staff to get the things you will need before starting the program. I wish I could provide more information in case an addict is looking for help,but I do know they are only a phone call away.

name: Sheena
text:
If you do not know anything or very little about ADDICTIONS, as well as, Recovery it is time we educate others and save more lives!! If you are an addict/alcoholic wanting help or if you know someone that needs help, reach out to the many different rehab facilities for information not only for the addict suffering but also for information for the entire family. We all have to start coming together and build one another up and help others succeed!!

Pearson Hall and The Fellowship House are two awesome programs! That is where my journey to living a clean and sober live began! I am truly grateful for their amazing staff members! Both facilities staff members are truly sincere, caring, loving, and want to help every addict/alcoholic that is ready for a new way of life!

name: Autumn Ashley Smith
text: This place was and is a great place to go for detox. The staff is very helpful and caring. The food is great, you definitely want go hungry. I had been on heroin for 5 years and with the detox meds, I didn't have one withdrawal symptom, which I thought was amazing when I found out that the majority of the meds were over the counter medication. If you want to go to a long term facility once you are released, they will set you up with one. As long as you want to get and stay clean and sober, this place is the perfect place to start. And for the negative reviews, the ONLY reason why you have posted negative stuff is because they didn't give you medications that give you a buzz. Why would you want to replace one addiction with another one. YOU have to want to get clean and sober for this to work, it's not going to if your doing it for someone else. Anyways good luck with your recovery and God bless.

text: This was by far our favorite shop at The Wharf. We got lucky and were there when the owners were in the store. name: Sierota Beth Brackett
text: My experience at A Coastal Zen was fabulous! The owners are warm and welcoming. I felt very much at home as I browsed through their collection of healing crystals, ritual candles & incense, inspirational/motivational art, spiritual & meditation tools, and all sorts of unique trinkets and decorations. The store is filled with interesting products from across the world. There is something here for everyone! The owners even showed me a few of their prized personal possessions which were kept in the back room, making me feel like V.I.P.  The store itself was well kept...which I can only imagine to be a constant struggle considering how many shelves and items must be dusted frequently to maintain the clean environment. Everything sparkles! If you have the chance, ask the owner about the musical vibrations produced by the bronze gong hanging behind the register -- it makes beautiful sounds which fill the space entirely, engulfing it's visitors in a sense of peace and tranquility. This store is just the kind of retail attraction our community needs in this area - Definitely recommend visiting A Coastal Zen as soon as possible!!! Bring more money than you think you will need because you will be surprised how many items will strike your fancy! The owners are well educated in product knowledge and price the pieces very, very reasonably. It's a treasure trove of goodies!!!

resp.text: Thank you so very much for such a glowing review. We love our customers and so look forward to you visiting us again.

name: John Kelly Douglas
text: It gives me hope for Montgomery that it can sustain a bookstore like this. Wonderful albeit small abolitionist and leftist collection. The volunteer working at the register was super friendly/knowledgeable and we ended up having a conversation about James Baldwin!

name: Paige Fernandez
text: A truly phenomenal book store AND community space. The second you walk in, you feel at home: warm smiles welcome you and a cozy corner invites you to sit down, relax, and look through some books. If you’re interested in any type of advocacy or activism, this is the space for you. It not only has the most essential reads dating back decades, but new reads by budding activists that will transform your perspective on the world. Brace yourself, as you’ll want to buy the entire bookstore once you’re done browsing.

name: Sydney Foster
text: 1977 Books is ran by some of the best community oriented humans who care about other humans needs and well being. I adore the stationary, totes and graphic tees. It’s a safe space to read a book to enhance your knowledge on social conscious matters or just meet a new friend.

name: Team Beziat
text: This is a true treasure for our city. The space is inviting, the books are amazing and the people are welcoming. Plus, they organize and host wonderful events for so many groups in our community. Be sure to stop by!

name: Ryan Dalton
text: I could not recommend 1977 Books more. They have an excellent selection of books—including, and especially, children’s books—and merchandise that is unmatched by any store in this area, probably even the state. Love the idea of the community space too. Much needed in Montgomery! ❤️

name: Jose Vazquez
text:
This bookstore is a-m-a-z-i-n-g. Beautifully curated and has books that I can’t find anywhere in the area. It’s also one of the few bookstores where the curation of books and items feels so intentional and special. I highly recommend visiting if you’re in downtown Montgomery.

Also, be sure to ask if the bookstore cat “Ham” is in, such a cutie!

name: Will Tucker
text: Excellent selection, super friendly and helpful staff and volunteers. Great place to go with your coffee from downstairs to find something to read!

name: bex kolins
text: An excellent selection of books. It was hard to not spend all my money! The shop is warm and full of life, as are the two owners. So glad a place like this exists in Montgomery!

name: Liz Richardson
text: Really cool addition to Montgomery, AL located in the historic Kress building. Hosts several progressive orgs around town. ❤️🏳️‍🌈

name: Ashley E.
text:
this bookstore is everything! 1977 books is on the second floor of the kress facing the dexter ave side.

selection: the books are carefully curated by community members and subject experts and reflect a commitment to sharing the work of people from underrepresented groups. i love that the bookstore also has a resource library of zines/journals/materials about movements and abolitionist practices in other communities. AND — if there’s something that a customer thinks the bookstore should add, the store creators are open and responsive to all suggestions!

environment: the bookstore is super cozy and has special touches that visitors are encouraged to add to (like the community altar!) also, there is ample seating available and a sweet children’s section for little ones.

events: the space is open for others to hold events like book clubs and other gatherings! this is awesome because sometimes it can be hard to find space to get together in the city and this is an accessible and warm place to bring a group.

all in all, i LOVE THIS PLACE!

name: J Cowan
text:
Great store. They have a great online collection and they will mail the books to you, if needed. I love their book bundles, and plan to order more from them. Highly recommend visiting their store or their shop
online.

resp.text: We're glad you like our book bundles! We're glad to ship to you anytime!

name: Veronica Cram
text: GREAT customer service whether online or in person.  I sent a list of books my daughter enjoys reading and they were able to put together a book bundle for her Christmas present.  Very happy!!

resp.text: We love putting together custom bundles for readers of all ages. Thanks so much for shopping with The Snail!

name: Rainne Cassidy
text: Ordered some books online from them. Came quite rapidly, along with some unexpected goodies! Thank you very much.

resp.text: Thanks for shopping our website, and we're so glad we had goodies to include! We do what we can for our customers.

name: Laurel Brown
text: Great service! I ordered a book that was backordered at the publishers, but it still arrived within a few days! Lady kept me updated about the status, from order to having it in stock, to delivery, which I appreciated!

resp.text: Thank you for shopping with us! We always try to get books to readers as quickly as we can.

name: Deb Watkins
text: Best bookstore that I have found not only online but in Alabama so far. They have everything you could need and the customer service is wonderful. The books ship on time and are in great condition. Couldn't be more happy.

resp.text: Thank you for being such a loyal customer! We appreciate our readers all over Alabama.

text: Love this place! Have traded books here over the past 8 or so years. I hate they are getting ready to close. Run by if you get a chance before they close their doors for good!

text:
Update: Went to take some books in that were given to me that I don't read and the lady that was there said they were too old, yet they had the same series on the shelves. She didn't bother really looking at them other than to keep one she wanted out of about 40 and we still bought a few books that day. Really disappointed, the sign doesn't say if the books are too old they won't take them, just trade 2 for 1. Hadn't had the desire to go back. Luckily, someone at Sonic wanted them and gave them to her.
Yes they have good books at really decent prices for used, paperbacks.

text: Awesome

name: James Burton
text: Very helpful over the phone.  Have had to call in several times to check prices (over a period of several years), and each time they were happy to help.

name: Randomly Russell
text: This is the worst book store I have ever been too in my life. Thankfully this is my last round of summer classes so I will never be coming back here again. One of the older employees that had clearly been there for some time was very rude to me when I tried to sell back textbooks. I had purchased each of them over the past 2 years at the particular bookstore for several hundreds of dollars and kept them in otstanding condition. After scanning them she said "actually, none of these have any sale value" in a very smart elec manner. She offered me no explanation as to why and did not offer any suggestions where they might have value either. She also did not greet me good bye. I know that my off campus bookstore, which yes is a chain with this store as well, in Tuscaloosa would have offered me something and been polite to me even if they could not buy them back from me either.

name: Susan McClarty
text:
What a joke!!!  I went there today to sell a biology book that costs $180 new, was still in the cellophane wrapper and is still in use at UAH, and they offered me $25 for it.  When I questioned the amount, the woman said "well I am not going to sell it as new" to which I responded that she was still going to sell in used for at least $100.  She glared at me and snobbishly told me that if I didn't like it I can take the book back, which I did.

If you want to be ripped off, this is the place for you!

name: Mary Ingram
text: They cannot (or will not,, not sure which one) order software.  Won't give prices over the phone and often not customer friendly :(

name: Tim Elam
text: A charming little bookstore with an interesting price structure. Books are half off the cover price plus 25¢. You can trade it in for a credit toward your next purchase. Selections range across all genres and most books are arranged in alphabetical order by author. If you like paperback mysteries, then this place is for you. From the classics to today's best sellers, you'll find plenty to read here.

name: Jodi Coon
text: This bookstore is hands down my favorite store ever. I live in Birmingham, but every time I come to Auburn I always plan in at least one visit to Auburn Oil. Their staff is amazing and friendly, they have cards with handwritten reviews on the shelves, they have an ever-rotating staff favorites section, and an incredibly well-organized store. One of my favorite parts is that even if I go in the store multiple times within a month, there's something new every time. The kids' section is wonderful too! One of my favorite activities both before and during the pandemic is to get a Rick Bragg coffee and peruse the store. If only they would open a second store in Birmingham!

resp.text: Jodi, Thank you! What wonderful words. On Monday, we will have been open one year (!) and yours is my favorite review ever! You've captured exactly what we have hoped to create, which makes me incredibly proud. We can't wait to see you on your next visit!

name: Brittany Garrison
text:
UNBELIEVABLE!!!! This store is nothing short of AMAZING. Yesterday I decided to treat myself to some new books. With a Pandemic happening around us it’s easier to just order a book online without needing to contact anyone else BUT I’m grateful I didn’t go about it this way. I messaged the online store about the “blind date” book program that they do (you should look into, it’s cute and a great way to find a new book BASED off of what you love rather than judging it by its cover....get it?) and surprisingly enough I was actually talking to a real life current worker! When I tell you that I have never once been spoken to in a bookstore much less asked for a suggestion (everyone has different taste, and I’m a little picky at times) I’m not lying. Katie (a ray of happiness and a great personality) not only gave me the information I asked for but then continues to give me suggestions, update me on new books to try, offer curbside services or porch drop offs AND thought of another book after hours and sent me an email with it( after I didn’t find a book Style that I was looking for, and the new book was a combination of genres I love!). Today I feel like I not only found 5 AMAZING books, but I was able to support a local business with and amazing staff that’s willing to go above and beyond. I was even greeted with smiles and the same enthusiasm from those that I picked my bag of goodies up from( didn’t catch their names but just as sweet and attentive!)
In Summary, a huge shoutout to Katie for making me feel special and taking such good care of me, as well as the other store workers! For those that seek this place out in Auburn, you will NOT be disappointed! This town needed a good hearted bookstore like this one and we need to support our local businesses!!! Go give my girl Katie some love!

resp.text: WOW. What a wonderful, thoughtful, kind review! Thank you for your thoughtful words and appreciation of our phenomenal staff. We do, indeed, have THE best people. It gives us genuine joy to serve wonderful customers like yourself. Thank you so much for not just supporting us during this crazy time, but also for reminding us about the beautiful spirit of this community.  - June

text: We just moved from Memphis...people warned us beforehand that Phillips Academy was not a good school and we should just move to another area. This school is nothing special. The campus is old, dark and in need of serious repairs. The staff is very unprofessional and vague. The teachers we encountered through the application process were very rude and ugly to the parents. We decided not to go forward when we finally visited the school and saw that most of the staff and students can barely speak proper english. I do not understand the need to be secretive about the application process when students that are already accepted and attending are not even excelling. It really is sad. Upon doing further research, I saw that the reading proficiency of students is only at 50% and the math proficiency is only 47%. That is horrible. Just look at the reviews from parents and students. The comments are filled with grammar and punctuation errors. This is definitely not a good place for my 3 children.

text: A small quiet dream of mine has been fulfilled- to have a charming neighborhood bookstore within walking distance of my house. My first purchase was for my husband who has a soft spot for design history and obscure facts! ‘The Secret Lives of Color’ is the most amusing and interesting read giving an in-depth synopsis on the origin stories and backgrounds of different color names and their historical influence. The owners are incredibly gifted in the literary arts and it shows through their thoughtful selection. I cannot wait to visit again.

name: Halley Cotton
text: The best bookstore in existence: owned and staffed by the very best people. Welcoming and community oriented, this place is magically wonderful. I buy all my books from Thank You Books (and you should too).

name: Stuart Oates
text:
To borrow a title from Hemingway, it is truly a Clean, Well-lighted Place for books.
It has been years that I have lost the habit of pleasure reading, but upon discovering Thank You Books )and making the decision to make time for pleasure reading again) this has changed.

On my first visit, I told the staff person that I have fallen away from the reading habit, and I asked her to recommend a book for me. Jokingly, I said that if I read it and didn't enjoy it, I would not return. I was back the following week and asked her for another recommendation.

Now, I have read two books that I likely would not have chosen on my own (and have enjoyed thoroughly). I can hardly wait for them to open today to get my following recommendation.

This is the experience that Amazon cannot replace. Thank You Books is owned and staffed by caring, literate, and passionate readers, and even if it weren't within walking distance from my house, I would drive across three counties To go there.

resp.text: Stuart, this is so kind. Thank you so much for shopping with us. We're thrilled that you've rediscovered the joy of reading for pleasure.

name: Gottfried Kibelka
text: A nicely curated selection of books, many with hand written reviews and recommendation posted on the shelf. Classics are mixed in with just published books emphasizing the fact that literature doesn't age as poorly as action movies. Bring time to browse, to communicate,  to get inspired, and leave with a book that you can't wait to crack open.

name: Seasick Records
text: Best bookstore in Birmingham! Great people! Go give them all your cash money!

resp.text: Love y'all.

name: Alexandra Gilmer
text:
I hate to draw too much attention to this perfect piece of paradise because Thank You Books is my absolute favorite place in Birmingham! Truth be told only a monster wouldn't enjoy a locally owned bookshop, yet the owners of Thank You Books make this space truly special through its curation.

I have never seen such an impeccable selection of children and young adult books, and I can always find something eye-catching on their diverse display tables. They have genuinely thought of everything and even have a small shelf set aside for paperback picture-book favorites, which make a notably cheaper but also travel-efficient option. I overuse that spot during little ones' birthdays to pick up a smattering of my nostalgia as gifts. The wall of recent staff picks is a place I secretly treat as a Cosmopolitan mag personality quiz to see which team member I am reading most like that week, and to find new things I may not even know existed. I haven't taken part in a book club yet although they do offer them, however, I have caught a story-time or two on Instagram live and think it's a sweet gesture that they have continued during the pandemic.

Ultimately, this little shop can do anything a big box bookshop can so I just don't go anywhere else because I am not the kind to question perfection!

resp.text: Al! You're gonna make us cry! Thank you for always brightening our day with your visits. We appreciate you so much!

name: Ella Oprandy
text: Great selection especially given its size. Robust children’s section too. Give them a visit and find your next great read!

name: Molly Dickinson
text: This store is delightful and obviously run with so much care. I ordered some merch because it's such a cute name and shop. It came with the sweetest note and thoughtful packaging. If I ever come through town, I'll be there in a heartbeat.

name: Rachel Bayerle
text: Thank You Books is exactly what Birmingham needed. A quaint, lovely bookstore with the most charming owners. Explore all of the worlds through their excellent selection of books. Let your and your kid’s imagination run wild in the fields of knowledge and artistry this nook of the city holds! Grab a pocket size of a classic to conveniently carry through your day, or get one of the owners to assist in finding your next adventure! Just be sure to visit this excellently curated home of pages.

name: Brenna Terry
text: LOVE this store! The owners are super friendly, and they sure know their books! They are passionate about what they sell and can make recommendations to any reader. The book selection is excellent and unique- many current bestsellers alongside favorite indie publishers and collections such as the New York Review Books Classics and Europa Editions. I've even seen a handful of titles and authors here that cannot be found right away in most chain bookstores. The kids' section is adorable, so bring the family! Plenty of works by local and state authors are available too. Don't overlook the goodies- journals, logo tees and tote bags, and gifts for readers. Overall a charming and cozy shop. You won't leave empty-handed!

name: Isaiah Woodsman
text:
They took the time to find the perfect book to help inspire a young boy's reading. They also directed me to other sources that they did not carry. A true sign that the goal was more important than the profit.

My own special order arrived quickly, another tell in their quality of customer service. I am happy to support this local business rather than send my money off to a distant corporation.

name: Taylor Stewart
text: Thank You Books is an absolute blessing. I always dreamed of having an independent bookstore in my neighborhood - and now it's here! Kristen, Laura, and Elizabeth choose each title with care - and they are all well rounded readers. During this very weird time in all of our lives I've loved getting a little package from TYB, but I miss being able to browse their shelves and listen to their recommendations in person. This is a great local shop to support - they have a lifelong customer in me.

name: Rainbow Grahamcrackers
text:
Part 1: The customer service is very sub-par; the lead dude that works there very clearly doesn't want to be there. I needed a kit for records management, and he said it was going to be there the Friday after Spring semester began. It wasn't. And he didn't seem the least bit concerned that I wasted time going with his word that it'd be in. I said "Okay, thanks!" (I totally was in no mood to say this) and went to leave, and there was no response at all. Who in customer service does that?

Part 2: We explicitly had a conversation about the payment for the books I did get from them. I'm using a student loan, which doesn't get disbursed until March 7th. Uninterested Dude explains that he'll just need me to come by once I get that disbursement to pay for the books. Which of course, is absolutely fine. By default, they also still need you to provide a card to put on record. Also fine. Here's the not-so-fine: The morons charge my effing card on February 20th, then again on the 26th!!! $288 out of an account that did not have it! No phone calls made to me whatsoever before doing it either. I will NOT be doing business with these sloths ever again!

Making a note to just save up enough money before semesters to just get them online, where the ACTUAL lowest book prices are.

name: Wriston Helms
text:
Not open to posted hours. Went 3 times, not open.
Update. They come back at my review with a snarky protest and suggest I can't read their sign or tell time.. Nice..
I assure you I can do both well.

The take-home message here is to check their Facebook page to see if they are following their own hours before you drive to the store.
Got it?

resp.text: Our hours are clearly posted on our facebook pg and on our front door of biz as being Tuesday through Saturday 10am to 5pm. If we ever have to close early, we make a sign on the door and post to social media. If we can't get up there we post to social media only. It's a shame that people have to leave vague negative reviews when we rarely close during our regular posted biz hours. If this person would've contacted us after "missing" us the first time we would have done what ever needed to be done to assist this potential customer but odds are they came on a day we are closed (always closed Sunday and monday) or they came after 5pm. It's that simple. I have documented time sheets that prove when our biz is open and many, many days we rarely close right at 5pm to accomodote shoppers in the store!

resp.text: Thank you for the great review and yes, don't blink or you will miss us. But, once you know where we are, you'll be baaacckkk. We put out new treasures, daily. Thanks again.
